title: The Great gardens of England
brief_description: This program takes us on a tour of three of England’s greatest gardens: the 10 acres of formal gardens at Hidcote Manor in the Cotswolds, established by Major Lawrence Johnston; Mottisfont Abbey on 13th century garden created by rose specialist Graham Stewart Thomas, and finally the most famous garden in England - Sissinghurst, in Kent, designed and planted by Harold Nicholson and Vita Sackville-West. Includes rare footage of Sissinghurst’s famous white garden.
